intro: Lippia rigida, commonly known as stiff lippia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its erect, stiff stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. Lippia rigida is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
